result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica M Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
DNA Surcharge waived.
First 120 days Huber with standard release conditions.  Last 60 days STAYED.

After Huber is served, Defendant to be compliant with Day Report Center for 120 days.
Consecutive to: Huber sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica M Hoffmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
WCS Direct Court Completion Notice.
Reviewed by the Court.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Recommendation approved by the Court, defendant to complete 15 hours of community service.
WCS Day Report Center Non-Compliance Report. Reviewed and approved by the Court, the defendant to complete essay based on WCS specifications.

Defendant Jessica M Hoffmann in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- 6 months jail.  First 120 days Huber with standard release conditions. Last 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released from Huber to Day Report Center for compliance for 120 days. 
- Court costs of $268.00; cash bail from 14CF170 to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- DNA Surcharge waived
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Sentencing hearing on August 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
